title: Health & Social Care News Archives
description: Within our Health and Social Care news section, we offer a variety of diverse material. Focusing on the most noteworthy stories in the sector from around the world.
cleaned_text: YUDU Sentinel discuss NHS Tayside choosing a new system and app to improve incident response and introduce digital documentation. [Could a moderate protein diet improve metabolism?](https://www.openaccessgovernment.org/moderate-protein-diet-improve-metabolism/160090/) In a groundbreaking study from Waseda University, researchers have investigated whether a moderate protein diet could improve metabolic health. [When it comes to social care reform, who's responsible for spearheading change?](https://www.openaccessgovernment.org/social-care-reform-uk-government-ageing/160150/) Half the British public does not believe care homes are capable of providing their loved ones with adequate care, and yet social care reform continues to lose out. [Excessive salt consumption linked to hypertension-induced dementia](https://www.openaccessgovernment.org/excessive-salt-consumption-hypertension-induced-dementia/160069/) A recent study published in the British Journal of Pharmacology has shed light on the association between excessive salt consumption and cognitive impairment resulting from hypertension. [Strong association between vaping and binge drinking](https://www.openaccessgovernment.org/vaping-nicotine-increased-levels-binge-drinking-substance-use/159870/) A recent study involving over 50,000 US adolescents has revealed a strong association between vaping and binge drinking, and cannabis use. [New regulatory pathway ensures safe access to medical breakthroughs](https://www.openaccessgovernment.org/pathway-ensures-safe-access-medical-breakthroughs-idap/159853/) Medical breakthroughs are quickly being accessed through a ground-breaking initiative, providing manufacturers and innovators with all-encompassing collaborative support. [Running keeps adult-born neurons wired and boosts memory](https://www.openaccessgovernment.org/running-adult-born-neurons-wired-boosts-memory/159783/) Florida Atlantic University and CINVESTAV, Mexico City, conducted a ground-breaking study exploring the effects of long-term running on a network of adult-born neurons. [AI tool can outperform humans in stroke identification](https://www.openaccessgovernment.org/ai-excels-study-shows-ai-tool-outperforms-humans-stroke-identification/159663/) Researchers from Denmark have developed a cutting-edge artificial intelligence (AI) framework that outperforms human emergency call-takers in the field of stroke identification This ground-breaking system... [How care technology can help alleviate the pressure on social care funding](https://www.openaccessgovernment.org/care-technology-alleviate-pressure-social-care-funding/159566/) Care technology has the potential to deliver better outcomes for service users, allow councils to do more with their limited budgets. [Preparing for the future: Canada's aging population](https://www.openaccessgovernment.org/preparing-canadas-aging-population-care-services-healthcare/159426/) Kamal Khera, Canada's Minister of Seniors, looks at what measures we can take to support Canada's aging population during the cost of living crisis. [COVID-19 experience for children in custodial settings](https://www.openaccessgovernment.org/covid-19-experience-children-custodial-settings/159283/) Dr Charlotte Lennox from the University of Manchester reports on the main findings of her research and argues that children in custodial settings were an invisible group during the COVID-19 pandemic, in this second of a two-part series. [Reinvigorating the battle for salt reduction: Is it time to tax salt?](https://www.openaccessgovernment.org/reinvigorating-salt-reduction-time-tax/159147/) Mhairi Brown RNutr, Action on Salt, discusses why Britain needs to eat less salt and why a salt reduction programme is absolutely necessary. [Sleep apnea patients have higher risk of stroke, Alzheimer's, and cognitive decline](https://www.openaccessgovernment.org/sleep-apnea-lack-brain-health-cognitive-decline-alzheimers/158922/) Sleep apnea patients with reduced deep sleep have a greater risk of brain biomarkers linked to stroke, Alzheimer's, and cognitive decline. [Government funds £2.3 billion into 160 new community diagnostic centres](https://www.openaccessgovernment.org/government-funds-new-community-diagnostic-centres-nhs/158928/) To reduce pressure on the NHS and improve patient care, the government will fund hundreds of new community diagnostic centres in local areas. [Exploring the science behind gene therapy in treating genetic diseases](https://www.openaccessgovernment.org/exploring-science-gene-therapy-treating-genetic-diseases/158872/) Professor Alan Boyd explains the science behind gene therapy, the challenges in treating genetic diseases, and current trends in the sector. [13 ways to tackle sugar addiction: Everything to know about having a sweet tooth](https://www.openaccessgovernment.org/tackle-sugar-addiction-sweet-tooth/158768/) What is a sweet tooth? What causes it? Why does it matter? What can we do about it? Here Dr Deborah Lee, Dr Fox Online Pharmacy, explores everything there is to know about having a 'sweet tooth' and 13 ways to tackle it. [GP technology funded £240 million to end 8am appointment slots](https://www.openaccessgovernment.org/gp-technology-nhs-appointment-slots/158721/) The NHS is improving patients' contact with their GPs with £240 million in funding, to better GP technology and train 'care navigators'. [Lumen device enables patients to monitor metabolism at home](https://www.openaccessgovernment.org/device-monitor-metabolism-at-home-lumen/158561/) The first-of-its-kind Lumen device can accurately measure metabolism through a CO2 sensor and flow meter, providing everyone with the freedom to monitor metabolism at home. [Government urges parents to check for measles vaccine as cases spike in children](https://www.openaccessgovernment.org/government-parents-measles-vaccine-cases-spike-children/158535/) The UK government has urged parents to check their children's measles vaccine records due to an increase in virus cases.
